title: Value Stocks Look Ready to ‘Take the Reins.’ Here’s Why.
text:
Is the great value-stock rotation finally upon us? Some signs indicate it is here, and it would be about time for fans of inexpensive stocks.

Value stocks are acting like a tightly wound spring that has started to uncoil, according to a report out Monday by Savita Subramanian, head of U.S. equity and quantitative strategy at Bank of America Merrill Lynch. Value has outperformed momentum by 9 percentage points in September. That is the widest divergence in performance between the two factors (or stock attributes) since 2010,...
